pull.title: doc: clarify processing of mempool-msgs when NODE_BLOOM
pull.body: Under which circumstances we process received 'mempool' P2P messages caused confusion in #27426. Rather than bike-shedding the formulation of the IF-statement, this adds a comment clarifying when we process the message. Also, correcting the `m_send_mempool` description.

verification.payload:
tree d850d8492e82918f3b7def728d5a03bf927156d4
parent da9f62f912294de07a595df0b4898aba4be6b69c
author 0xb10c <b10c@b10c.me> 1683066262 +0200
committer 0xb10c <b10c@b10c.me> 1683066262 +0200

clarify processing of mempool-msgs when NODE_BLOOM

Under which circumstances we process received 'mempool' P2P messages
caused confusion in #27426. Rather than bikeshedding the formulation
of the IF-statement, this adds a comment clarifing when we process
the message. Also, correcting the comment of `m_send_mempool`.

Co-authored-by: willcl-ark <will8clark@gmail.com>

events.message:
clarify processing of mempool-msgs when NODE_BLOOM

Under which circumstances we process received 'mempool' P2P messages
caused confusion in #27426. Rather than bikeshedding the formulation
of the IF-statement, this adds a comment clarifing when we process
the message. Also, correcting the comment of `m_send_mempool`.

Co-authored-by: willcl-ark <will8clark@gmail.com>

issue.title: Doesn't register non-upper-case ACKs
issue.body:
Not sure if this would cause unintended side-effects, but my "Ack" here was missed:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26257#pullrequestreview-1172862157

comments.body: I think it makes sense to also document this in `src/protocol.h`, which generally refers to the p2p version and the BIP number. I read BIP 35, 37, and 111, but I couldn't find a mention that the message type is guarded by NODE_BLOOM. So maybe this can also be mentioned in `src/protocol.h`?
@0xB10C did you want to follow up here?
